Review Title: Hotel Central - The clue is in the title. Go there - they have cake!
Negative Reviews:
Unusually for a 4-star hotel, there was no kettle in our room. To fix this, the hotel staff were helpful - every day they gave us a large thermos flask of hot water and allowed us to take a cup from the cafe. In the morning we would return them.
Our bathroom needed some maintenance - the sink had a small leak from the mixer tap internals which dripped onto the floor; the shower door could slam into the wall and potentially shatter. Fixable stuff. Though it wasn't a problem for us, the nearby clock may annoy some late risers in the morning.
Positive Reviews:
Hotel Central is in an excellent location, as the name suggests. From the airport, the F line bus drops you off at the far end of Anichstraße where it meets the pedestrianised Maria-Theresien-Straße. From here you have an 8 minute walk via the Sparkassenplatz shopping square, accessed via a colourful illuminated tunnel. You will see the famous Cafe Central ahead. Upon arrival, all the reception staff are friendly, speaking German and English at least. It's minutes away from the tourist office and all the bus and tram lines you'll ever need.
It's a nice hotel with some quirks - their sauna must be requested in advance; the bar was never open; the cafe is so popular that reservations are recommended (in the morning buffet breakfasts are served here, while later in the day it serves great coffee and cake in style, like an intellectual speakeasy). There are lifts, a luggage room and a ski/bicycle storage room. There is an underground carpark. Beds are comfortable and the place is clean. In the morning, a nearby clock starts its chimes on the hour from 7am which we found useful. The free ski bus to the Stubai Glacier departs outside the hotel on certain days. 
Put simply, I would stay there again.

I also highly recommend the infrared sauna and fitness room, if you’re that way inclined: the fitness room is fairly basic but has a weights section as well as cardio equipment, which is great, and I wish I could’ve taken the infrared sauna home!

The best thing about the hotel, though, was the staff, all of whom were exceptionally helpful and kind. I will be coming to Innsbruck in the future, so will definitely stay here again too.

We recently stayed at Hotel Central in Innsbruck and had a rather disappointing experience. The only positive aspect of our stay was the hotel's excellent location, which is conveniently close to the central area and the river.

Unfortunately, the rest of our stay did not meet our expectations for a four-star hotel. The rooms lacked air conditioning, and we were provided with only a standalone fan. This made the room uncomfortably hot, leading to poor sleep quality.

The bathroom was another point of contention. It was quite small, particularly the space between the basin and the toilet, which felt very cramped.

Additionally, we encountered an issue with the room's safe box. When we attempted to access our passports and money, the safe wouldn't open. We contacted the reception desk, but the receptionist was unhelpful and rude. He initially told us that we would have to wait until the next day, citing a holiday, which was unacceptable since all our valuables were inside the safe. After a prolonged argument, he finally said he would send someone to our room. We waited for 20 minutes before a very polite gentleman arrived and opened the safe within two minutes.

To add to our frustration, the internet was not working during our stay due to an internal problem in the hotel.

I am typically the kind of traveler who tries to minimize criticism and tolerate regular shortcomings that are beyond the hotel's control, especially since my wife and I are retired and travel frequently throughout the year. However, our stay at this hotel was a combination of frustrations that caused us significant emotional and physical discomfort.

Overall, our experience at Hotel Central was far from satisfactory. The lack of air conditioning, the small bathroom, the poor service from one of the reception staff, and the internet outage made our stay quite uncomfortable. We had higher expectations for a four-star hotel and were disappointed with the level of service provided.

Review Title: Enjoyable visit to a beautiful town marred by an uncomfortable stay.
Negative Reviews: The bedroom set up was totally impractical. It was on two levels.  The lower level had a sofa bed made up and the upper level a queen (or king) size bed made up which was where we slept. Only seat on lower level was a low padded cube on rollers, way too low to sit at the high bench to use a computer. My wife brought down a wicker chair and table  from the upstairs sun room so she could work in the small space between the end of the sofa and the wall.  Furniture up stairs did not include any sort of work or storage bench. Storage for travel bags was under the stairs and awkward and difficult to use without banging one’s head on the overhead stairs and there was no nearby area to sort goods after or before packing. We would probably stay again if we could choose a more functional room.
